meanings.definition: To repair the mortar joints of (a brick or stone wall).
meanings.sent1: I will repoint the wall to fix the cracks.
meanings.sent2: The mason will repoint the old brick wall next week.
meanings.sent3: Why did the wall need repointing? It looks like it's frowning!
meanings.sent4: As the mason repointed the wall, it felt like giving it a new lease on life.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the trowel scraping against the bricks as he repointed the wall echoed through the street.

meanings.definition: To fill in or repair the joints of (a masonry wall).
meanings.sent1: She carefully repointed the bricks to make the wall strong again.
meanings.sent2: The old castle needed repointing to prevent further damage.
meanings.sent3: The mason joked that repointing the wall was like playing a giant game of Tetris.
meanings.sent4: The way she repointed the wall with precision was like an artist restoring a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The sunlit courtyard looked brighter after she repointed the walls, as if it had received a facelift.

meanings.sent1: He had to repoint the compass to find his way back.
meanings.sent2: The sailor needed to repoint the ship's direction after the storm.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked the student to repoint the pencil before drawing the line.
meanings.sent4: After recalibrating the telescope, he had to repoint it towards the stars.
meanings.sent5: The detective had to repoint his suspicions towards a new suspect in the case.
